Per the manual, the default SSID is '''802.11b-SSID'''. *[http://rtl8181.sourceforge.net/rtl8181_devices.php ''On the known RTL8181-based consumer devices list'' at '''rtl8181.sourceforge.net'''] {{SCollapse2|Known Linux on Realtek RTL8181-based consumer devices |

Glossary:
- 8201 = Realtek RTL8201BL Single-Port 10/100M PHYceiver (link)
- 8305 = Realtek RTL8305SB Single-Chip 5-Port 10/100M Switch Controller (link)
- IP101 = IC+ Plus IP101 Single-Port 10/100M Transceiver (link) - apparently interchangeable with RTL8201BL
- SA2400 = Philips SA2400 single-chip radio (link, datasheet)

Lists compiled by other projects (not RTL8181 related)
*http://hri.sourceforge.net/hw/

Hardware Reviews • MMU-based hardware
======================================

Name • FCC ID • Chipset • Memory • Original firmware • Comments • Details

*Netgear WG602 • Wi-Fi Router (g)
CPU: IDT 32334 (79S334) - MIPS with MMU support (specification) 
4M Flash • 16M SDRAM • Intersil 54g WiFi • 20-pin JTAG?
IDT EvalBoard source code access: lftp ftp2.idt.com / user: apps / pass: 29apps28
OpenRG distribution for Linux 2.2.14 

*Linksys WRT54G • Wi-Fi Router (g) (Potentialy Similar Design: Netgear FWAG114)	
CPU: Broadcom BCM4702KPB - MIPS with MMU support (no more details in public domain) 
4M Flash • 16M SDRAM • 9-pin UART? • 10-pin JTAG? • Linux 2.4.5 
Running Snort on WRT54G • Sveasoft Open Source Firmware - replacement of original firmware 

*Linksys WRV54G • Wi-Fi Router (g)
CPU: Intel IXP425 - ARM with MMU support 
4M Flash  • 16M SDRAM • Linux based OpenRG 

*Linksys BEFSR41C-JP • Broadband Router 
(maybe the same as BEFSR41) (Similar to Uniden ENR1504?)
CPU: KS8695 - ARM922 with MMU support • 20-pin JTAG/UART interface?
1M Flash (Macronix MX29LV800TTC-90) • 8M SDRAM (Winbond W986432DH-6) 

*Uniden ENR1504 • Broadband Router
CPU: KS8695 - ARM922 with MMU support 
1M Flash • 8M SDRAM • JTAG interface
UART interface • Nucleus RTOS

*Uniden WNR2004  • WiFi Router (Similar to ENR1504)
CPU: KS8695 - ARM922 with MMU support 
1M Flash • 8M SDRAM
JTAG interface • UART interface • Nucleus RTOS

======================
Name • FCC ID • Chipset • Memory • Original firware • Comments

*D-LINK DI-604 rev A • no wireless • OEM ID: GKWRT-4GO
CX84200 (ADM5106) • 1M Flash • 8M SDRAM
JTAG header • NO serial • ThreadX
Firmware in ARJ format • HRI details

*D-LINK DI-604 rev E • no wireless • OEM ID: GLWRT-CG0-B10
CPU: Marvell 88E6208 (ARM9 CPU @133 MHz)
1M Flash (MX 29LV800BTC-90) • 8M SDRAM
JTAG header • Serial header (UART?) • ThreadX
Firmware in ARJ format	Jerome's details

KA2DI614-PLUS	OEM ID: GL2422RT-0T2
Samsung S3C4510 • 1M Flash • 8M SDRAM
Wi-Fi chipset ACX100 • JTAG header
NO serial • ThreadX • Firmware in ARJ format

KA2ACX100 • OEM ID: GL2422RT-1T7
CX82100 • 1M Flash • 8M SDRAM
Wi-Fi chipset ACX100 • JTAG header
ThreadX • Firmware in ARJ format

Intersil ?

Atheros AR5002 ?

*D-Link DI-624 rev C • Wireless router
Atheros AR5004 ?

AMIT SoC-0261 (@143MHz) • (flash, RAM and ethernet to be confirmed)
2MB Flash (HY9F002TC-70) • 16MB DRAM (GLT5160L16-7TC)
5 port ethernet chip (AT8985P) • Printer port
no JTAG, unfinished serial • AMIT Kernel ?

*D-Link DWL-G810 • KA2DWLG810 • KA2DWLG810A1
OEM from Global Sun Tech ?
Marvel chip ? • No headers • need better checking

*D-Link DWL-900AP • Wireless router
KA2-DW1150 • OEM from Global Sun Tech
Samsung S3C4510 • Wi-Fi chipset AT76C510
2M Flash (MXE021451) • 8M SDRAM (Samsung K4S643232E)
JTAG • NO serial • ZIP contains an EXE (Argh!) 

*D-Link DWL-900AP • Wireless router
O7J-GL242204-0T • OEM from Global Sun Tech
Samsung S3C4510 • Wi-Fi chipset ACX100
2M Flash (MXE021451) • 8M SDRAM (Samsung K4S643232E)
JTAG • NO serial • ZIP contains an EXE (Argh!)  
Tom's Hardware review

*D-Link DWL-900AP+ (A&B) • Wireless router
KA2DWL900AP-PLUS • OEM ID: GL2422AP-0T4
Samsung S3C4510 • Wi-Fi chipset Prism
Flash 29LV800BTC-90 • RAM Winbond W986432DH-5
Ethernet VIA VT6103 • 
JTAG header • NO serial • Firmware in ARJ format

*D-Link DWL-900AP+ (C) • Wireless router
OEM ID: GL2422AP-1T1-B10 • CPU: ARM9
Firmware in ARJ format

*Benq AWL500 • jwpawl500
Samsung S3C4510B • 1M Flash • 2M SDRAM?
JTAG header • Unfinished serial connector

*Airlink+ ASOHO4P • Internet Router
Marvell 88E6208 (ARM9 CPU @133 MHz)
1MB Flash (ST M29W800DB) • 64MB SDRAM (VT52L1664LC)
4 Auto-MDI ethernet ports + 1 ethernet port (WAN) 
20pin JTAG header • Unfinished serial connector • DLF format

*CompUSA WE711AP • Wireless Access Point
Conexant CX84200 • JTAG header • Serial connector
1MB Flash MX29LV800-TTC-90 • 4MB SDRAM AD481M3222VTG-7

*CompUSA Cable/DSL • Broadband Router
Samsung S3C4510B • w/ 4 port 10/100Mbps Switch
512kB Flash 29LV400TTC-90 • 4MB SDRAM D98SD1616A1(x2)
JTAG header • Serial Connector • uClinux Ported! 

*Netgear RP614 • Samsung S3C4510B
1M Flash 29LV800 • 8M SDRAM EM63816STS-7
Broadcom BCM5325 switch
JTAG header ?? • Serial connector
	 
*NorthQ 9100 • Samsung S5N8947
1MB Flash 29LV800BTC-? • 8MB SDRAM W986432DH-6
IC+ IP175A ethernet switch
UART connector, no level shifter
Firmware in "double ZIP" format

*SMC7004VWBR v1 • HEDWG3005B1-17 • CX84200 (75MIPS)
1M Flash • 8M SDRAM • Wi-Fi ATMEL ? (Card SMC2632W-V2)
JTAG interface • UART interface • VxWorks
Firmware in "double ZIP" format	HRI Port!

*SMC7004VWBR v2 • HEDWG3005DACC • OEM from Accton
ADM8628 (@75MHz 8KB cache ARM7TDMI)
SoC has two ethernet ports and one 802.11b port
Firmware self-decompressing, gzip format. Extension DLF 

*SMC7004VBR v1 (Almost the same as SMC7004VWBR v1)
CX84200 (75MIPS) • 1M Flash • 8M SDRAM
JTAG interface • UART interface • VxWorks
Firmware in "double ZIP" format	HRI Port!

*SMC7004VBR v2 • RISC900X
NO headers at all • Firmware on unknown format

*SMC7004WFW • HEDACC7004WFW
CX82100 (ARM9 150MIPS) • 4 port ethernet • Wireless
20 pin header (JTAG?) • 8 pin header • Supertask
Board has serial and parallell connector space, don't know if usable
Firmware in "double ZIP" format 

*SMC7004FW • (Great chance being like SMC7004WFW)
CX82100 (ARM9 150MIPS) • Supertask
Firmware in "double ZIP" format	Review 

*SMC7004ABR v1 • OEM: AMIT (from www.amit.com.tw)
CPU: CX82100 •20pin (JTAG?) without headers
Wind River Systems (DLF)

*SMC7004ABR v2 • CPU: Samsung S5N8947
Serial, Printer port, UART, JTAG etc. • VxWorks
Firmware in "double ZIP" format	HRI Port!

*SMC7004AWBR v1 • HEDWG3004A-17 • (USR 8011)
CPU: CX84200 ? (ARM7 60MIPS) • P/N 750.5312 • VxWorks ???
OEM: AMIT • Firmware mentions Intersil Prism

*SMC7004AWBR v2 • HED7004ACC (Siemens Speedstream 2623)
OEM:Accton • P/N 750.5435 • Wind River Systems (DLF)
CPU: Samsung S3C4510B or S5N8947? (need confirmation!)
ADMtek DM6996 Ethernet switch • WLAN MAC is based on Atmel AT76C502
SMSC SP37E760 (PC style 2x UART, 1x Parallel Super I/O chip)

*SMC7404WBRA • HED7404WBRAACC
CPU: Samsung S3C4510B • ADSL modem included ?

*SMC2404WBR • OEM ID: GL2422RT-0T3-S01
CPU: Samsung S3C4510 ? (ARM7 60 MIPS ?)
11/22Mbps • ThreadX • Firmware in ARJ format

*SMC2804WBR v1 • HEDWG4005ACC
Samsung S3C2510A (ARM940T) • Supertask

*SMC2804WBR v2 • HED2804WBR
ISL3893	? • ISL Project

8MB SDRAM (Hynix HY57V643220CT-6)
